entries: {@i Stamina Surge+1.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.

items.name: Rathian Plate
entries: Du är immun mot {@condition poisoned} när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Rathian Ruby
entries: Du är motståndskraftig mot giftskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Rathian Scale
entries: If you coat this weapon with poison, the poison's save DC is increased by 2.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: När du kastar en besvärjelse som ger brandskador ger den 1d4 extra brandskador.

items.name: Rathian Spike
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat it. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. This weapon can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rathian Tail
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d4 poison damage.

items.name: Rath Wingtalon
entries: When you attune to this weapon, a ring manifests on one of your fingers. While you wear it, you can use an action to fire a slender wooden dart from the ring at a target within 20 feet of you. Make a ranged weapon attack; you have proficiency in the ring. On a hit, the target takes 1 point of piercing damage, and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution save or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. It can repeat the save every 4 hours; if it succeeds three times, the effect ends, but if it fails three times, it dies. Once used, you cannot use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rathian Plate
entries: When you cast a spell that deals poison damage, you increase its spell save DC by 1.

items.name: Rathian Ruby
entries: När du håller i det här vapnet får du +1 bonus på trollformelattacker och du ignorerar halvt skydd när du gör en trollformelattack.

items.name: Rathian Tail
entries: Rare armor or weapon upgrade material.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The remobra makes two tail attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Poison Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

Remobra are classified as Flying Wyverns in the Old World but, have recently been reclassed as Snake Wyverns. The Remobra have evolved wings, which are fairly large in comparison to their body size in the Old World. Despite their wings being large, their legs are relatively weak and they can barely stand up with their legs. To avoid standing up, they spend of their time in the air flying. It preys upon weakened animals, by using their poison to finish off their victim and letting it bleed to death.

items.name: Remobra Hide
entries: Du minskar nekrotisk skada med 2 när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Striped Skin
entries: {@i Luck.} Roll a d20 at the end of a successful hunt. On a 18-20, you get one additional material from the creature.

items.name: Remobra Head
entries: {@i ill Omen.} Your Charisma score increases by 1 while you wear this armor, but you have disadvantage on {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} checks due to an overwhelming feeling of disaster to those around you.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the rhenoplos moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The rhenoplos has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) blåslagningsskada.

Rhenoplos is a quadrupedal, Ceratopsian-like monster with an armored body. Its face features a small nose horn and is surrounded by a frill. While the eyes of Rhenoplos are not particularly proficient, their hearing is. Rhenoplos charge blindly at whatever sound startles them, including large monsters. However, this makes them easy to dodge and easy prey for predators placing them near the bottom of the food chain with most other herbivores. These creatures live in small groups, spending most of their days traversing the hot environments while foraging for shrubs and other plant matter.

items.name: Rhenoplos Shell
entries: Du minskar brandskador med 3 när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Rhenoplos Scalp
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery Novice.} While attuned to this weapon, you can add your Strength modifier to the damage of your shell attacks.

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: Ger 2 dagars ransonering när den tillagas.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Ovanligt material för uppgradering av rustning.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Ludroth kan andas luft och vatten.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The royal ludroth makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, end the poison on a successful save.

action.name: Mucus Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: The royal ludroth spits a glob of mucus at point within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot radius of that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage and be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't afflicted with waterblight on a successful save. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on a successful save.

It has a crown-like crest composed of several finger-like appendages tipped with black spikes as well as a large, spongey yellow mane. The Royal Ludroth has a long, serpentine body with four squat limbs. Its hind pair of legs are shaped like paddles for swimming, and its foremost pair are more muscular, tipped with developed digits ending in long black claws. Its jaws are lined with shear-like plates in the place of teeth.

As the alpha male, Royal Ludroth will usually roam around with a harem of {@creature ludroth|MHMM|females} in tow. It is an aggressive creature, and will lash out at anything that threatens it or its clan.

items.name: Spongy Hide
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to cold damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: R.Ludroth Scale
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain +2 AC while completely submerged in water.

items.name: Royal Aqua Sac
entries: You can hold your breath underwater for twice as long as normal.

items.name: R.Ludroth Tail
entries: {@i Divine Blessing.} When you take damage you are not immune or resistant to, roll a d4 and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: R.Ludroth Crest
entries: {@i Constitution.} Varaktigheten av fördröjande effekter, såsom {@spell slow} trollformeln eller en koppardragons andningsattack, reduceras med hälften när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: R.Ludroth Claw
entries: This weapon deals maximum weapon damage to a creature that has an innate swimming speed.

items.name: Royal Aqua Sac
entries: You can cast the {@spell water breathing} spell once per long rest, while attuned to this weapon.

items.name: R.Ludroth Tail
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become poisoned with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} until the end of their next turn.

items.name: R.Ludroth Crest
entries: Ditt vapen ger extra 1d4 kallskador.

items.name: Dash Extract
entries: Hantverksmaterial för {@item mega dash juice|AGMH}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the nergigante fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nergigante has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spiked Regrowth
entries: The nergigante has spikes covering its body. When used, broken, or removed in any way; the spikes regrow instantly.
Additionally, the nergigante can use its spiked explosion immediately after it uses an action or legendary action as part of the same action or legendary action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nergigante can use its frightful presence. It then makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its horn, and two with its claws.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the nergigante's choice that is within 120 feet of the nergigante and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nergigante's Frightful Presence f or the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Meteor Crash {@recharge 5}
entries: The nergigante leaps into the air using its wings to hover briefly and comes crashing down in a 15-foot square area within 90 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 80 ({@damage 23d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spiked Explosion
entries: The spikes on the nergigante explode outward in a 40-foot-sphere around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and begin to bleed from a vicious wound on a failed save or half as much damage and do not bleed on a successful one.

A creature that suffers from a vicious wound loses 4 ({@dice 1d8}) hit points at the start of each of its turns. Each time the creature suffers from another vicious wound, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 4 ({@dice 1d8}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Dragon Eater
entries: The nergigante feeds on the corpse of a dragon. A large or smaller dragon is consumed whole, while the nergigante can feed on a Huge or bigger dragon for up to 30 seconds. For each round the Nergigante feeds on a dragon, it heals for an amount equal to the dragons Challenge rating.

legendary.name: Hunger
entries: The nergigante uses its dragon eater, but only heals for half the amount it normally would.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
entries: The nergigante makes a wing attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nergigante moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the nergigante moves through must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 32 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Ruiner Nergigante is built similarly to {@creature Nergigante|MHMM}, albeit with darker scale and carapace. The variant's defining feature are the metallic spikes that grow in between their regular bone spikes on its forelimbs, nape, and wings. These spikes are much tougher and make deadlier weapons compared to the normal ones, increasing its spike explosion radius and causing a bleeding effect.

items.name: Eternal Regrowth Plate
entries: När du bär den här rustningen får du 1d6 Hit Points var 10:e minut, förutsatt att du har minst 1 Hit Point. Om du förlorar en kroppsdel gör rustningen att den saknade delen växer igen och återgår till full funktionalitet efter 1d6 + 1 dag om du har minst 1 träffpunkt hela tiden.

items.name: Nergigante Cortex
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+3.} När du bär den här rustningen kan du använda en handling för att kasta {@spell haste} trollformeln från den en gång om dagen, men du kan bara rikta den mot dig själv när du gör det.

items.name: Nergigante Hardclaw
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 3d4} piercing damage to them. This damage bypasses resistance and immunity, and can't be reduced or avoided by any means.

items.name: Nergigante Flail
entries: När du bär denna rustning blir varje kritisk träff mot dig en normal träff.

items.name: Immortal Shard
entries: You have resistance to nonmagical damage while you wear this armor. Additionally, you can use an action to make yourself immune to nonmagical damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Annihilating Greathorn
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain a +3 bonus to AC, you are immune to fire damage, and you can understand and speak Draconic. In addition, you can stand on and walk across molten rock as if it were solid ground.

items.name: Eternal Regrowth Plate
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

items.name: Nergigante Cortex
entries: {@i (Bow only)} As a bonus action you can grow a black spike from the palm of your hand and nock it to your bow. A creature hit by this spike suffers normal weapon damage and the spike lodges itself into the creature. A creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet for every spike impaled into it. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to pull out the spikes, or if some other effect removes them, the creature's movement speed returns to normal.
You are able to grow up to 10 black spikes. You are unable to grow anymore until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nergigante Hardclaw
entries: Ditt vapen ger 2d6 extra snittskador.

items.name: Nergigante Flail
entries: When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target also has the {@spell dispel magic} spell cast on them at 5th level.

items.name: Immortal Shard
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 2d8 piercing damage.

items.name: Annihilating Greathorn
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, your strength score changes to 29. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the weapon's score, the item has no effect on you.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Material för uppgradering av vapen av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Material för uppgradering av rustning av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the safi'jiiva fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The safi'jiiva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Suppressed Power
entries: The safi'jiiva is unable to use its sapphire star while it is above (225) half of its maximum hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The safi'jiiva can use its frightful presence. It then makes five attacks: three with its bite, and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the safi'jiiva can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw}. {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the safi'jiiva's choice that is within 120 feet of the safi'jiiva and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the safi'jiiva's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Siphon Energy
entries: While on the ground, the safi'jiiva siphons the energy from the earth, regaining 70 hit points.

action.name: Cone of Flames {@recharge 5}
entries: The safi'jiiva exhales a beam of blue flames that arcs across a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sapphire Star (1/day)
entries: The safi'jiiva rises into the air releasing a gout of blue flames below it until the start of its next turn. The flames cover the ground in a 45-foot radius around the safi'jiiva. Each creature that starts its turn in the flames or enters them for the first time on a turn must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

On the safi'jiiva's next turn but before it moves, it can use its action to release a bead of concentrated magical force that slowly falls to the ground. Upon impact at the end of the safi'jiiva's turn, the bead explodes and each creature in a 60-radius must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage plus 56 ({@damage 16d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The safi'jiiva makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The safi'jiiva makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Blue Flame Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The safi'jiiva exhales a burst of blue flames in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in a line must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature that was {@condition grappled} by the safi'jiiva bite attack automatically fails their saving throw and is pushed 30 feet away from the safi'jiiva landing {@condition prone} on the ground.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Shard
entries: {@i Biology.} Du blir duktig på {@item dung bomb|AGMH} när du bär den här rustningen, och du är immun mot blight-effekter som {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} eller {@spell blight}-besvärjelsen.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Cortex
entries: {@i Evade Window+.} Den här rustningen har 5 runor, och den återfår 1d5 förbrukade runor dagligen i gryningen. När du misslyckas med ett räddningskast för Dexterity när du bär den kan du använda din reaktion för att använda 1 av dess runor för att lyckas med räddningskastet istället.

items.name: Safi'jiiva HardHorn
entries: While wearing this armor you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Lash
entries: While you wear this armor it casts bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Additionally you and friendly creatures standing within this bright light have advantage on saving throws to resist becoming {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Fellwing
entries: While you're wearing this armor, you can speak its command word as an action to gain the effect of the {@spell etherealness} spell, which lasts for 10 minutes or until you remove the armor or use an action to speak the command word again. This property of the armor can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Pulsing Dragonshell
entries: You have immunity to fire damage, and resistance to cold and lightning damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Zionium Crystal
entries: While you are wearing this armor you gain the following benefits:

items: You regain consciousness on a roll of 19 or 20 on death saving throws.
You can cast the {@spell regenerate} spell from it, but only target yourself. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Shard
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Cortex
entries: {@i Critical Boost+.} You can roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a weapon attack.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Hardclaw
entries: Your weapon and other material effects in it ignore resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Safi'jiiva HardHorn
entries: Ditt vapen ger 2d6 extra brandskador.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Lash
entries: {@i Elderseal.} En varelse som träffas av det här vapnet kan inte använda en handling som har en uppladdning fram till början av din nästa tur. Varelsen kan fortfarande rulla för att ladda upp sin förmåga i slutet av sin tur.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Fellwing
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you add a d8 to your initiative at the start of every combat. Additionally this weapon has one rune. You can expend this rune at the start of combat to become first in the initiative order, no matter your roll. You regain the rune after 24 hours, but once before you regain the use of this feature, at the start of another combat, the DM can make you last in the initiative order.

items.name: Pulsing Dragonshell
entries: {@i Dragonvein Awakening.} This material cannot be placed in a trinket. When placed in a weapon it gains the following benefits:

items: When a creature must make a saving throw against a spell, weapon effect, or other abilities that inflicts a condition, the save DC is increased by 2.
Your weapon attacks critical hit range is increased by 1.

items.name: Zionium Crystal
entries: {@i True Dragonvein Awakening.} This material cannot be placed in a trinket. When placed in a weapon it gains the following benefits:

items: When a creature must make a saving throw against a spell, weapon effect, or other abilities that inflict a condition, they do so at disadvantage.
Your weapon attacks critical hit range is increased by 2.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Material för uppgradering av vapen av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Material för uppgradering av rustning av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the deviljho moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a body slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Om deviljho misslyckas med ett räddningskast kan den välja att lyckas istället.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deviljho has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deviljho makes two attacks: one with its body slam and one with its bite.

action.name: Body Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target must make a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 ft and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is wearing any nonmagical metal armor it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dragons Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The deviljho unleashes a terrible breath in a 60-foot cone. Each Creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage and 49 ({@damage 11d8}) necrotic damage and they are afflicted with {@disease dragonblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and are not afflicted with {@disease dragonblight|MHMM} on a successful one. The afflicted target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The deviljho makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature that is {@condition prone}. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite damage, the target is swallowed, and no longer {@condition prone}. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the deviljho, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the deviljho turns.

If the deviljho takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the deviljho must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the deviljho. If the deviljho dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The deviljho moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The deviljho makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 actions)
entries: The deviljho makes one bite attack or uses its swallow.

Savage Deviljho are rare special {@creature Deviljho|MHMM} individuals that are abnormally old with an extreme hunger. They can be found practically anywhere like then normal deviljho, and easily assert themselves as super predators that rival elder dragons in any conceivable habitat they find themselves in and are challenged by little.

The Savage Deviljho has many of the same adaptations as a normal Deviljho, however, has a few minor differences. Savage Deviljho are noticeably always enraged. This due to being extremely hungry and constantly needing to feed. Their face is covered like a mask of dragon element, giving it a more sinister look and the hide and the blood of savage deviljho is black in color due to the effects of this element.

The savage deviljho is an even more brutal and rabid monster than the ordinary variety due to its unrelenting hunger. The black blood may drive the savage deviljho to such heightened aggression, even causing it to become a 'rogue' killing machine.

With its appearance in the New World, Savage Deviljho's supreme height in the food chain is finally confirmed. The infamous Variant of the World Eater has been seen directly confronting Elder Dragons like {@creature Velkhana|MHMM}, {@creature Namielle|MHMM} and {@creature Blackveil Vaal Hazak|MHMM}, resulting in violent elemental clashes that often end explosively in stalemates. Perhaps even more terrifyingly, the Savage Deviljho's physical prowess has increased to the point which it can feasibly stand against the immensely powerful Elder Dragon Variant {@creature Ruiner Nergigante|MHMM}, one which specializes in unyielding physical strength.

items.name: Savage Hide
entries: {@i Carving Celebrity+.} While you are attuned to this armor, you can carve a creature of CR 15 or lower 1 extra time.

items.name: Savage Scale
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} När du är inställd på den här rustningen kan du använda alla förbrukningsvaror, såsom dryck eller mat, som en bonusåtgärd, så länge det är du som förbrukar dem.

items.name: Savage Scalp
entries: När du bär den här rustningen smakar du i alla riktningar, och du har fördel på visdomskontroller ({@skill Perception}) som bygger på smak.

items.name: Savage Saliva
entries: You cannot be {@condition frightened} while you wear this armor.

items.name: Savage Tail
entries: While you wear this armor, you can use an action, to speak the armor's command word and attempt to magically swallow either a creature, or object, that is Medium or smaller. An unwilling creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw to escape the armor's grasp. Once swallowed, the creature or object is transported to a room that exists on a plane of existence found only within the armor. The room is a 10 foot by 10 foot cube, and can hold a single, living creature, and up to 1,000 pounds of objects. There are two windows on one of the walls that peer out, giving vision of the outside world.

För varje timme som går kan en varelse försöka fly genom att lyckas med ett {@dc 15} räddningskast i styrka. Vid ett lyckat försök kräks varelsen upp och faller {@condition prone} i ett utrymme inom 10 fot från dig. Dessutom, närhelst du tar 40 skada eller mer på en enda tur, måste du lyckas med ett {@dc 16} räddningskast i Konstitution, eller regurgitera alla svullna varelser och alla svullna föremål, som faller liggande i ett utrymme inom 10 fot från dig. Genom att tala rustningens kommandoord på nytt spottar du ut varelsen eller ett föremål efter eget val.

items.name: Savage Gem
entries: Du är immun mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Savage Talon
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit+.} När du har fördel på en anfallsrulle med det här vapnet och du träffar målet, kan du låta vapnet orsaka maximal skada om den lägsta av de två d20-rullningarna också skulle träffa målet (alla extra skadetärningar måste fortfarande kastas). Du kan använda den här egenskapen ett antal gånger som är lika med din styrka- eller dexteritetsmodifierare (ditt val), och återfår alla förbrukade användningar när du avslutar en kort eller lång vila.

items.name: Savage Tallfang
entries: {@i Partbreaker+3.} Du orsakar 1d10 extra skada när du träffar kritiskt med det här vapnet.

items.name: Savage Scalp
entries: When you cast a necromancy spell, you gain a +3 bonus to its spell attack roll or increase its spell save DC by 2.

items.name: Savage Saliva
entries: {@i (Sorcerer & Wizard only)} Vapnet har 10 runor. Du kan använda en handling för att använda en eller flera av dess runor för att kasta en av följande trollformler från det, genom att använda din spelled save DC: {@spell cause fear|XGE} (1 runa), {@spell ray of enfeeblement} (2 runor), {@spell ray of sickness} på 3:e nivån( 3 runor), {@spell contagion} (4 runor), eller {@spell harm} (6 runor). Vapnet återfår 1d6 + 4 förbrukade runor dagligen i gryningen. Om du förbrukar den sista runan kan det inte återfå några runor på en vecka.

items.name: Savage Tail
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 fire damage and an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

items.name: Savage Gem
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can speak its command word to exhale a beam of hellfire in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} fire damage and {@damage 5d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yian garuga makes three attacks: two with its peck and one with its tail. Or it makes three fire ball attacks.

action.name: Fire Ball
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Fire Barrage {@recharge 5}
entries: The yian garuga exhales a barrage of fireballs in a 60-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Flight
entries: The yian garuga flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Poisoned Tail
entries: Choose a creature within 10 feet of the yian garuga. That creature must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Piercing Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The yian garuga lets out an ear shattering roar. Each creature that is within 20 feet of the yian garuga must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

In terms of appearance, scarred yian garuga is virtually identical to {@creature yian garuga|MHMM}. The main difference between the two is that one of this monster's ears is missing and Scarred Yian Garuga received a scar across its face.

The scarred yian garuga hunt almost exclusively at night, using its deadly poison or stabbing its prey to finish off its victim. It is just as aggressive as the yian garuga, but has adapted its attacks over its many battles, including the ability to unleash a barrage of small fire balls whilst its in the air. If hunting another predatory species such as a {@creature velocidrome|MHMM}, Yian Garuga will first stun the creature with its roar before launching any attacks.

Azure Rathalos, Pink Rathian, {@creature Tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature Nargacuga|MHMM}, and the rare {@creature Rajang|MHMM} are fierce competitors of the Bird Wyverns and are even capable of killing them if an opportunity were to arise. However, being one of if not the most feared member of the Bird Wyvern class these creatures are fully capable of defending themselves against potential threats.

items.name: Garuga Shard
entries: While wearing this armor, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, your sight range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Garuga Cortex
entries: {@i HG Earplugs.} Medan du är inställd på den här rustningen kan du använda en bonusåtgärd för att trolla fram två öronproppar i valfri form. När du använder dessa öronproppar kan du bara höra varelser som du väljer att kunna höra och du har fördel på räddningskast mot åskskskador.

items.name: Garuga Silverpelt
entries: You can use an action to speak this armor's command word and regain one expended spell slot of up to 4th level. Once you have used this effect, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Garuga Fellwing
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition poisoned} condition, you do so with advantage.

items.name: Garuga Lash
entries: {@i (Druid Only)} While you wear this armor, your wild shapes last a number of hours equal to your druid level and you can use your wild shape one additional time.

items.name: Fancy Beak
entries: You have advantage on initiative rolls while you wear this armor.

items.name: Garuga Auricle
entries: You cannot be {@condition poisoned} and you have resistance to poison damage while wearing this armor.

items.name: Garuga Shard
entries: If you coat this weapon with poison, the poison's save DC is increased by 3.

items.name: Garuga Cortex
entries: {@i (Bows only)} Your {@item poison coating|AGMH} now lasts for 1 minute, but the target can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the poison on a successful save.

items.name: Garuga Silverpelt
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Dina vapenattackers räckvidd för kritiska träffar ökar med 1.

items.name: Garuga Fellwing
entries: {@i Abnormal Status Atk up (M)}. Whenever you inflict a condition on a creature or object that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, the maximum duration of the condition is increased by 12 seconds.

items.name: Garuga Lash
entries: {@i Resentment.} Fram till slutet av din tur får du en +1 bonus på attack- och skadekast mot alla varelser som har skadat dig sedan slutet av din senaste tur.

items.name: Fancy Beak
entries: {@i Critical Status (poison).} When you make a weapon attack with this weapon, and roll a 20 for the attack roll, the target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Garuga Auricle
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d10 poison damage.

items.name: Garuga Lash
entries: Very Rare armor upgrade material.

trait.name: Carpet Bomb
entries: För varje 6 meter som bazelgeuse flyger, lossar den en explosiv skala som landar i ett obebott utrymme direkt under den.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: Om bazelgeuse flyger och dyker minst 30 fot rakt mot ett mål och sedan träffar det med en huvudstötattack, ger attacken ytterligare 4 ({@dice 1d8}) skada på målet.

trait.name: Explosive Scales
entries: The bazelgeuse scales, when dislodged from its body, act as a time bomb. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties) all scales explode dealing 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage to all creature in a 10-foot radius of them.

trait.name: Shed
entries: Whenever the bazelgeuse makes a melee weapon attack it dislodges an explosive scale which lands in an unoccupied space with 5 feet of its location.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 100 hit points or fewer, the bazelgeuse enters a "superheated" state gaining advantage on attack rolls. In addition, Explosive Scales grow, increasing their explosion radius by 5 feet and deal an extra {@dice 1d6} fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bazelgeuse makes three attacks: one with its headbutt, one with its wing, and one with its tail.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) blåslagningsskada.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: No Man's Landing {@recharge}
entries: The bazelgeuse soars 30 feet into the sky while scattering 15 explosive scales in a 60-foot radius around it, that are at least 15 feet apart. It then comes crashing back down to the ground creating a 20-foot wide explosion. Each scale in the explosions area is destroyed, and each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 14d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Fling
entries: The bazelgeuse dislodges 3 explosive scales and sends them flying with its tail. Choose a location within 60 feet of the bazelgeuse, each scale lands in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of that location.

legendary.name: Fire Breath (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The bazelgeuse exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 46 ({@damage 7d12}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The seething bazelgeuse is a dominant predator like their {@creature bazelgeuse|MHMM|regular cousins}, if not much more so. The Variant species could easily defend its turf even with the recent ecological intrusion that brought the likes of {@creature glavenus|MHMM}, {@creature brachydios|MHMM} and {@creature tigrex|MHMM} into the Recess. Said monsters would rather not fight Seething Bazelgeuse unless they really had to, as a confrontation with the wyvern warrants a harrowing battle and serious injury.

Like their respective regular species, seething bazelguese are huge competition for {@creature savage deviljho|MHMM} in the ecosystem, in which they mutually have few contenders. Fights between the two creatures are among the most destructive clashes in the natural world, with both having tremendous power of their own. Aside from monsters mentioned above, seething bazelgeuse have to keep their guard up for Elder Dragons which are not uncommon in the Recess.

While most of their trait remains similar, seething bazelguese are much more dangerous than their regular cousin due to their advanced explosive scales. This adaptation is credited to a substance the Commission dubbed "Distilled Blast Fluid", which are naturally produced within a seething bazelgeuse body.

The fluid reacts to seething bazelgeuse's state of being, either reacting to adrenaline or through other biochemical process and would progressively make bazelgeuse bomb scales more combustive the longer the creature is in aggravated state.

This enhancement peaks when the monster's explosive scales emit a fiery purple glow and produce explosions roughly twice the size and power of normal scales. The scales also gains a sticky property to them in this enhanced state, allowing them to latch to surfaces before inevitably exploding.

There's a limit to this mechanism however, as seething bazelgeuse periodically have to "reset" themselves after generating supercharged scales for some time. The process can also be sabotaged through powerful enough blows to bazelgeuse's scale-making organ.

There are no significant difference in behavior between seething bazelgeuse and the regular species. The variant however seem to be more accustomed to direct combat on the ground instead of relying on carpet bombing and dive-bombs, which makes them tougher foes for hunters and other monsters alike.

The variant have also shown a degree of improved tactical thinking and creativity, often throwing their scales some distance around themselves and up-close opponents. This limits the safe zone their enemy could evade to, making it much more difficult to maneuver around bazelgeuse's widereaching physical attacks. The far-flung scales could also work nicely as weapon or deterrent against enemies that attack from distance, which the normal species were very weak against.

items.name: Bazelgeuse Shard
entries: Your armor has 10 explosive scales that regrow at dawn. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use a reaction to cause one of these scales to explode dealing {@damage 3d4} fire damage to the attacker.

items.name: Flickering Silvershell
entries: {@i Airborne.} While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: Bazelgeuse Hardclaw
entries: {@i HG Earplugs.} Medan du är inställd på den här rustningen kan du använda en bonusåtgärd för att trolla fram två öronproppar i valfri form. När du använder dessa öronproppar kan du bara höra varelser som du väljer att kunna höra och du har fördel på räddningskast mot åskskskador.

items.name: Distilled Blast Fluid
entries: Du är immun mot brandskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Scorching Silverwing
entries: {@i (Lance & Greatsword only)} Your Guard AC bonus now lasts until the start of your next turn and you cannot be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Bazelgeuse Flail
entries: You have an emblem of a burning brazier on your armor. You can use an action to speak the armor's command word and summon a {@creature fire elemental}, as if you had cast the {@spell conjure elemental} spell. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long or short rest.

items.name: Seething Gem
entries: {@i Guts+2.} When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Bazelgeuse Shard
entries: {@i (Melee Weapon only)} When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes burned for 1 minute. A burned creature takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage at the start of their turn. A creature may use its action to put out the flames early.

items.name: Flickering Silvershell
entries: {@i Critical Draw+.} Under den första stridsrundan får dina närstridsvapenattacker en kritisk träff med ett kast på 15 eller högre.

items.name: Bazelgeuse Hardclaw
entries: Ditt vapen ger 1d10 extra brandskador.

items.name: Distilled Blast Fluid
entries: {@i (Sorcerer & Wizard only) Bombardier+.} The weapon has 12 runes, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell aganazzar's scorcher|XGE} (2 runes), {@spell heat metal} (2 runes), {@spell scorching ray} (2 runes), {@spell melf's minute meteors|XGE} (3 runes), {@spell wall of fire} (4 runes), {@spell delayed blast fireball} (7 runes). The weapon regains 1d8 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Scorching Silverwing
entries: When you make a weapon attack with this weapon, and roll a 20 for the attack roll, the target and each creature within 5 feet of it, excluding you, must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw taking {@damage 3d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

items.name: Bazelgeuse Flail
entries: Du får en +2 bonus på dina trollformelattackrullningar och dina spelledningsskydd när du är inställd på det här vapnet. Den här bonusen ökar till +3 när trollformeln du kastar ger eldskador.

items.name: Seething Gem
entries: När du är inställd på det här vapnet ändras din styrka till 25. Om din styrka redan är lika med eller större än 25 har materialet ingen effekt på dig.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The seltas makes three attacks, two with its Claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Seltas is a large, mantis like insectoid with a brightly-colored, highly resistant exoskeleton, which is covered in spines and knobs. He has six legs, the foremost pair are armored and weaponized for combat, and a pair of collapsible wings. His head is hidden beneath a large, armored canopy that extends far beyond the rest of his upper body. He has a pair of compound eyes and powerful slicing mandibles. Seltas is the male counterpart to the {@creature Seltas Queen|MHMM}.

Seltas is predatory in nature, both large and powerful enough to prey on both hunters and small monsters alike. He is known to attack from the skies and use his weaponized forelimbs to attack. In addition, he is commonly known to attach himself to his massive female partner and transport her with his powerful wings.

When he is forced to merge with Seltas Queen, he will struggle at first to escape. But when the merge has been completed, he will fight alongside Seltas Queen without question as if hypnotized. He won't even fight back when being eaten by his mate, indicating that Seltas Queen has full control of Seltas.

Seltas possess an organ within their body that produces a disgusting liquid. This liquid can be used as a weapon, and as a means of feeding, as the liquid is highly corrosive by itself. Seltas have a long, armored canopy that can be used to pierce through predators and prey alike, which is also able to pierce through rock with their powerful speed. The main weapon of the Seltas, his claws, are used as weapon and as tool to hold down and subdue prey.

items.name: Seltas Shell
entries: You reduce cold and necrotic damage you take by 2 while you wear this armor.

items.name: Aqua Sac
entries: You can hold breath underwater for twice as long as normal while you wear this armor.

items.name: Seltas Wing
entries: While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell feather fall} spell from it. Once used, you can't use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: Seltas Wing
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery.} While attuned to this weapon, your wyvernfire can now be used twice per long rest.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: {@i Capture Novice.} While attuned to this weapon {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s and {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo} roll an extra 2d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: Seltas Horn
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Load Up.} Din normala ammunitionskapacitet ökar med 10 när du är inställd på det här vapnet.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: This oily like substance can be applied to the skin of a medium or smaller creature. Applying the substance takes 1 minute. The affected creature then has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for 1 hour. During this time if they attempt to {@condition charmed|PHB|charm} a creature with spells or spell like abilities, the targeted creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.
{@i Cursed.} When applied to a creature, there is a 10% chance to attract nearby seltas while in urban areas. While in the wilds, there is a 50% chance to attract nearby seltas.

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Ovanligt eller sällsynt uppgraderingsmaterial som kan användas för vapen eller rustning.

trait.name: Drone Slave
entries: As a Bonus Action, the seltas queen can take a {@creature seltas|MHMM} as a drone slave. the seltas and the queen take up the same spaces (though they can be targeted seperately) and the seltas queen gains a flying speed of 60 feet. The Seltas must use its action every turn to hold onto the Seltas Queen

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The seltas makes two attacks, one with its claws and one with its horn. Or three water orb attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d12 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The seltas queen cannot use her tail attack on another target until this grapple ends.

action.name: Water Orb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 40/160 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Call for Aid (1/day)
entries: The seltas queen calls out for assistance, summoning 2 {@creature seltas|MHMM} to aid her.

The Seltas Queen is a very large, beetle-like Neopteron with an armor-like exoskeleton covering its body. She is primarily a lustrous green color, but also features beige stripes and orange spines. She has six limbs, four of which make contact with the ground, the other two being used for digging and grasping prey. In addition, she has a long, segmented tail with a large pincer-like structure at the end. Seltas Queen is the female counterpart to {@creature Seltas|MHMM}, although she is physically very different.

These creatures are the largest known species of Neopteron to date. In fact, they are so heavy that whenever they walk the ground will shake. Seltas Queen have massive and powerful legs that end with two claws. These powerful limbs not only enable the giant insect to climb up rocky, uneven terrain, but greatly make the task of burrowing easy. The large pincers on the tail are mainly used for defense but, can also be used as a another limb for both grabbing objects and prey alike. In its tail, there are specialized organs that produce pheromones that'll send a Seltas flying to a female's exact location. When the male is within range, the female will quickly grab it and inject a special pheromone-like substance that causes the male to cease struggling. The male is then under the female's complete control and will do whatever she requires of him. If in battle, both the male and female will fight as one, this makes fighting the deadly Seltas Queen even deadlier as the two Neopterons will fight as one. A Seltas Queen is also capable of spitting balls of high-pressured watery mucus from its mandibles to slow down and injure prey.

Leading a mainly solitary lifestyle, Seltas Queen will only seek out the company of a Seltas if needed. Whether it be for food, mating, transportation, or added protection a Seltas Queen won't hesitate in releasing her specialized pheromones to bend a male to her will. Amazingly if in battle and in dire need of sustenance a Seltas Queen will not hesitate in violently killing and then eating her male counterpart to survive.

items.name: S.Queen Shell
entries: While wearing this armor you can summon a baby seltas for 1 hour. During this time, it clings to your back and grants you a flying speed of 10 feet. Once used, you can't use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: S.Queen Pectus
entries: {@i Hero Shield.} You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from CR 2 or lower creatures while you wear this armor.

items.name: S.Queen Claw
entries: Du är motståndskraftig mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Torrent Sac
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can use a bonus action to exhale an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
När du har använt den här egenskapen kan du inte använda den igen förrän du har vilat länge.

items.name: S.Queen Shell
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery+.} När du är inställd på det här vapnet kan din wyvernfire nu användas två gånger per lång vila och du kan lägga till din styrka-modifierare till skadan av dina granatattacker.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: {@i Capture Expert.} While attuned to this weapon {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s and {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo} roll an extra 2d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: S.Queen Pectus
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Load Up+.} While attuned to this weapon, you increase the maximum capacity for all of your ammo by 2.

items.name: S.Queen Claw
entries: {@i Ammo Saver+.} When you make a ranged weapon attack and roll a 15 or higher on the attack die, the ammunition returns to you unbroken after hitting the target(s).

items.name: Torrent Sac
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} This weapon has 5 runes. While holding this weapon, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following Spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell charm person} (1 rune), {@spell feather fall} (1 rune), {@spell ray of frost} (1 rune), {@spell Enhance ability} (2 runes), or {@spell Enthrall} (2 runes). The weapon regains 1d4 + 1 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: S.Queen Extract
entries: An upgrade material that can be used to upgrade your weapons or armor to rare or very rare.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: This oily like substance can be applied to the skin of a medium or smaller creature. Applying the substance takes 1 minute. The affected creature then has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for 1 hour. During this time if they attempt to {@condition charmed|PHB|charm} a creature with spells or spell like abilities, the targeted creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.
{@i Cursed.} When applied to a creature, there is a 10% chance to attract nearby seltas while in urban areas. While in the wilds, there is a 50% chance to attract nearby seltas.

trait.name: Bladed Scales Regrowth
entries: The seregios has fourty-eight bladed scales. Used scales regrow when the seregios finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Open Wound
entries: When a creature is hit by the seregios attacks, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an open wound. Each time the seregios hits the wounded target with an attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The seregios makes three attacks: one with its tail and two with its talons or three with its bladed scales.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If this attack hits a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The seregios can grapple one large creature, or two medium creatures at a time.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bladed Scales
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Seregios are powerful, territorial and highly aggressive predators. With their razor sharp weapons a Seregios can make short work of their unfortunate victims. Larger Seregios have been seen flying with smaller Flying Wyverns clutched in their talons, including other Seregios. Reports like this confirm that the wyverns will cannibalize each other. Due to their capability of living in a number of different environments, Seregios compete with a large number of other large predators. Seregios have also been witnessed aggressively attacking {@creature Rathalos|MHMM} and {@creature Rathian|MHMM} (including their subspecies) and are said to be serious rivals toward them.

The Seregios is covered in extremely sharp Blade Scales. These scales are capable of cutting through the armor of certain prey and flinging them at a distance with good aim. On impact the scales will embed themselves in the victim like shrapnel and can leave complicated gouges in prey and even rocks. The wounds the scales leave behind are extremely painful for the victim and said pain can last for long periods of time, possibly causing infections as well. The most defining trait that this species is that they have Zygodactyly feet like roadrunners and other birds. Seregios are the only species in the Flying Wyvern class that possess them. The feet of these creatures can be used as devastating weapons against prey and enemies alike. A hunting Seregios use their feet to grasp their prey in a vice-like grip giving their victims little hope for escape. When in flight the claws on their wings are utilized for control and to allow them to shift their weight more easily. A Seregios is one of a few wyverns whose flight mobility and control is comparable to a Rathalos. Seregios will also utilize the thick, sturdy blade-like horns on their heads along with their blade-scaled covered tails in combat.

Seregios are hostile usurpers of the land. They are violent fighters and will battle other monsters in order to kick them out of their territory claim it as their own, this includes their own kind in their land. In most cases, the monster they are fighting will end up dead after the battle and while some live on. The bigger the Seregios, the larger amount of territory it needs. Once a territory is gained by a Seregios, it will mark its territory with its own Blade Scales.

items.name: Seregios Slavescale
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can conjure a magical comb as an action. Running this comb through your hair allows you to change the length, color, curliness, and style of your hair. After running the comb through your hair, your hair is also cleaned and has a pleasant fragrance.

items.name: Seregios Airblade
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell blade ward} spell from it as a bonus action. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Seregios Carver
entries: {@i (Requires a shield)} While attuned to this armor, the front of your shield is shaped in the likeness of a face. While bearing the shield, you can use a bonus action to alter the face's expression.

items.name: Seregios Impaler
entries: While you wear this armor, any creature that hits you with a melee weapon, an unarmed strike, or a natural melee weapon takes 1d4 piercing damage.

items.name: Seregios Scraper
entries: {@i Constitution.} Varaktigheten av fördröjande effekter, såsom {@spell slow} trollformeln eller en koppardragons andningsattack, reduceras med hälften när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Seregios Slavescale
entries: As an action, you can try to cast a cantrip that you don't know from the warlock spell list. When you do, you must succeed on a {@dc 10} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. On a successful check, you cast the cantrip. Once you use this property, you can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Seregios Airblade
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can conjure a finely crafted halfling dagger, this dagger can whittle one small object once per day without the use of its master.

items.name: Seregios Carver
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to conjure a coin from thin air, this bronze coin always lands on tails.

items.name: Seregios Impaler
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or lose 1d4 hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an open wound. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

items.name: Seregios Scraper
entries: Ditt vapen ger 1d4 extra snittskador.

items.name: Seregios Dissenter
entries: {@i Critical Draw.} During the first round of combat your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 17 or higher.

trait.name: Frenzy
entries: When a creature has 3 Frenzy Charges, they must makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a fail, the target is afflicted with the {@disease Frenzy Virus|MHMM} until dispelled by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell. On a success, the frenzy charges reset to 0.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the shagaru magala can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the shagaru magala fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shagaru magala makes four attacks, two with its bite and two with its Claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) piercing damage and the target gains 1 frenzy charge.

action.name: Viral Discharge
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage and the target gains 1 frenzy charge.

action.name: Virus Geysers {@recharge 5}
entries: The shagaru magala spreads spores in a large vortex around itself. It then launches itself 60 feet in the air creating multiple 5 foot spore geyesers in a 60 foot radius around it. The shagaru magala may choose up to 3 creatures in the area that must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 14d8}) necrotic damage and gain 2 frenzy charge on a failed save. On a success, a target takes half the damage, and does not gain any frenzy charges.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The shagaru magala makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

legendary.name: Bad Breath
entries: The shagaru magala makes a Viral Discharge attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The shagaru magala beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the shagaru magala must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The shagaru magala can then fly up to half its flying speed.

Shagaru Magala is the "adult" form of {@creature Gore Magala|MHMM}, which transforms by shedding its black skin. Following the skin-shedding, its body is now covered in glittering golden scales, as well as its horns, claws and other spiky protrusions, which changed colors from crimson red / purple to dark brown. The once hidden eyes underneath the horns are also now fully opened. Its ragged-tattered wings also became golden scaly sheets that when fully expanded, resembles a star shape (more specifically, when both wings are expanded.)

Having reached adulthood, Shagaru Magala's physical abilities are greatly enhanced; they are much stronger, more agile, and most of all, more ferocious. Apart from more aggressive melee attacks like the clawed wings-pounce and a grab attack that involves crushing and then hurling hunters around like a ragdoll, their virus breath attacks are also enhanced; with the range of the explosion being larger and dealing more damage.

Like its "juvenile" form these drakes have highly specialized wings ending with four large talons at the end that can act as an extra pair of arms. This is very useful when climbing up cliff faces or gripping struggling prey. When exposed to bright sunlight its wings will also refract light into multicolored rays. In their juvenile form as a Gore Magala it lacks eyes, but upon metamorphosing it loses its heat sensors and gains useable eyes. Unlike a Gore Magala it lacks the virus carrying hairs on its wings and instead uses a currently unknown mechanism to spread the {@disease Frenzy Virus|MHMM}. A Shagaru Magala is capable of making the Frenzy Virus cover a much greater range than that of its "juvenile" form and has the potential of killing every animal in a single area. The virus strain also seems to be more intense, easily corrupting a mighty beast like {@creature Zinogre|MHMM} and turning pack-monsters like the {@creature Great Baggi|MHMM} and {@creature Baggi|MHMM} against each other. The dark virus aura that envelops a Shagaru Magala is so intense that it's said to dissipate only once the progenitor monster is dead.

These dragons are highly aggressive and territorial predators that won't hesitate in attacking hunters if spotted. Like elder dragons, Shagaru Magala are very rare and are considered myths in some lands. Part of this due to the fact that it takes years for a Gore Magala to molt. Many believe that when the molting process is about to begin said creature will travel to the Heaven's Mount to complete the process. In legend Shagaru Magala is known as "The Punishing God of the Mountains" due to its role of nearly wiping out all life in the mountains. The reason for this is to claim territory for themselves, prevent rivals from molting properly, and to release the next generation of Gore Magala into their territory. Their infected mist not only contains a stronger version of the Frenzy Virus but also their parasitic offspring. Their offspring live in an infected host, whether it is dead or alive, and their host acts as nursery for the young. They get their nutrition and everything they need from their host before eventually bursting out of their host's body. Once Shagaru Magala is finished breeding in a territory, it'll leave the area for its next generation and begin to wander around the world randomly. They don't reproduce again for quite awhile due to trying to prevent future monster generations from gaining a resistance against their virus while reproducing. Thus far, only three Shagaru Magala have been sighted, two of which have been killed. Many people believe that the Shagaru Magala and Gore Magala represent light and darkness.

items.name: S.Magala Shard
entries: {@i Handicraft+3.} I 24 timmar får du varje gryning färdighet i tre valfria hantverksverktyg.

items.name: S.Magala Cortex
entries: {@i Gourmand.} While attuned to this armor, you double the amount of days you can go without food or water before suffering a level of exhaustion.

items.name: S.Magala Purifier
entries: {@i (Lance only)} While you are wearing this armor, you cannot be knocked {@condition prone}. Also, your AC bonus from its guard property now lasts until the start of your next turn.

items.name: S.Magala Lightwing
entries: While wearing this armor, you can use an action to speak its command word to grow wings that look like the Shagaru Magala's. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet for 24 hours or until you end the effect as an action. Once used, this property can't be used again for 3 days.

items.name: S.Magala Lash
entries: Du är motståndskraftig mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: S.Magala Prismwing
entries: Du har fördel på räddningskast mot trollformler när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Pure Scale
entries: Du är immun mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: S.Magala Phosgem
entries: This armor has 5 runes. It regains 1d4 + 1 runes daily at dawn. When you roll a Dexterity saving throw or you roll for initiative, you can expend 1 rune to gain advantage on that roll before you make it. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to expend 2 runes and halve the damage you take from that attack, unless the damage is necrotic.

items.name: S.Magala Mantle
entries: While attuned to this armor, you have {@sense truesight} out to a range of 60 feet.

items.name: S.Magala Shard
entries: {@i Peak Performance.} När dina träffpunkter är fulla och du kastar en 1 eller 2 på en skadetärning för en attack som du gör med ett närstridsvapen, kan du kasta om tärningen och måste använda den nya tärningen, även om den nya tärningen är en 1 eller en 2.

items.name: S.Magala Cortex
entries: {@i Quick Load.} Du kan ladda om som en fri handling när du är inställd på det här vapnet.

items.name: S.Magala Purifier
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

items.name: S.Magala Lightwing
entries: {@i (spellcaster only)} This weapon has 3 runes that it regains daily at dawn. When you hit a creature, you can expend 1 rune to cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell using your save DC centered on the target. If you are in the area, you automatically succeed on the save.

items.name: S.Magala Hardhorn
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d10 radiant damage.

items.name: S.Magala Prismwing
entries: {@i Latent Power +2.} När du reduceras till hälften av dina maximala träffpoäng för första gången i strid eller i början av din tur på den 10:e stridsrundan, beroende på vad som inträffar först, får du effekterna av {@spell haste} besvärjelsen i 1 minut. När den använts måste du avsluta en kort eller lång vila innan du kan använda den här egenskapen igen.

items.name: Pure Scale
entries: {@i Trump Card.} You have advantage on attack rolls vs creatures that are {@condition grappled}.

items.name: S.Magala Phosgem
entries: {@i Elderseal.} En varelse som träffas av det här vapnet kan inte använda en handling som har en uppladdning fram till början av din nästa tur. Varelsen kan fortfarande rulla för att ladda upp sin förmåga i slutet av sin tur.

items.name: S.Magala Mantle
entries: This weapon has 2 runes that recharge daily at dawn. You may expend a rune to cause three 60-foot tall spore geysers, that are 5 feet wide, to erupt from the ground. These geysers must appear within a 60 foot radius around you. A creature within a geysers area, must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or take {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

items.name: Pure Frenzy Crystal
entries: A crystal so pure it hardly belongs in this world. Sows destructive impulses.

items.name: Vile Frenzy Crystal
entries: A sanity-robbing crystal. The Guild demands these be turned in immediately.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the shah dalamadur can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the shah dalamadur fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shah dalamadur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The shah dalamadur deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Uncontrolled Metabolism
entries: The shah dalamadur have no control over their metabolism. At the start of its turn roll a {@dice d4};

items.name: On a 1-2,
items: The shah dalamadur overheats and gains the following benefits and loses any benefits it had from the previous turn:

items.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the shah dalamadur's turns, each creature within 10 feet of it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the shah dalamadur or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

items.name: Burn
entries: When the shah dalamadur hits a creature with a bite attack, tail attack, or with its constrict; that creature begins to burn, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns until a creature takes an action to douse the fire.

items.name: On a 3-4,
items: The shah dalamadur cools to almost freezing temperatures and gains the following benefit and loses any benefits it had from the previous turn:

items.name: Frozen Hide
entries: The shah dalamadur hide repels most attacks. It has resistance to all damage except psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shah dalamadur can use its frightful presence. It then makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 27} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the shah dalamadur can't constrict another target.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the shah dalamadur's choice that is within 120 feet of the shah dalamadur and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the shah dalamadur's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Rattle
entries: Using the hypnotic sounds from the rattle on its tail, the shah dalamadur chooses one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the shah dalamadur's spoken and telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm from the dalamadur or another creature or receives a suicidal command from the shah dalamadur, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the shah dalamadur's Rattle for the next 24 hours. A creature that is {@condition Deafened} is immune to this effect.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The shah dalamadur exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw, taking 88 ({@damage 16d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Squeeze
entries: The shah dalamadur makes a constrict attack.

legendary.name: Rattle (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The shah dalamadur uses its Rattle.

legendary.name: Meteor (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The shah dalamadur opens its mouth and magically creates three swirling balls of blue fire, launching them into the sky, each of which can strike a different target the shah dalamadur can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Shah dalamadur is the undisputed apex predator of its habitat. Although its diet is unknown, it is almost certainly carnivorous, and herbivorous monsters such as {@creature aptonoth|MHMM}, {@creature conga|MHMM}, and {@creature rhenoplos|MHMM} would be easy prey. Given its incredible size, predators such as {@creature tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature deviljho|MHMM}, stygian zinogre, azure rathalos, {@creature rajang|MHMM} and even the infamous {@creature shagaru magala|MHMM} would most likely avoid the beast at all costs.
Shah dalamadur are far more aggressive than any mere {@creature dalamadur|MHMM} due to them being in a sort of defenseless state after molting.

Shah dalamadur sport a lighter, sand-colored hide with red-orange spines after molting out of their old skin. After molting, shah dalamadur have no control over their metabolism, meaning their body temperature will constantly change. When cold, a shah dalamadur's hide can repel most attacks. When hot, the hide of a shah dalamadur is vulnerable to most attacks. From their body temperature constantly changing, shah dalamadur are able to perform an ability never seen before by a normal dalamadur. Shah dalamadur are able to burn the very ground with their powerful heated metabolism through just about any part of their body that is heated. This heat can leave behind powerful flames with just a single touch.

items.name: S.Dalamadur Fanblade
entries: {@i Pack Rat.} När du är inställd på den här rustningen kan ditt sällskap samla dubbelt så många resurser som normalt under en jakt.

items.name: S.Dalamadur Gazer
entries: {@i Guts+2.} When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: S.Dalamadur Steel
entries: {@i Nimbleness.} Du har en fördel på Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) kontroller och Dexterity räddningskast när du bär den här rustningen. Även när du utsätts för en effekt som gör att du kan göra ett räddningskast för att ta endast halva skadan, tar du istället ingen skada om du lyckas med räddningskastet, och endast halva skadan om du misslyckas.

items.name: S.Vortex Bone
