legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The velkhana covers the ground in a 15-foot radius in rime for 1 minute and it beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The velkhana can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Hail Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The velkhana forms five boulder-sized chunks of ice from the water in the air that plummet to the ground at different points within 90 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on each point that it chooses must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one ice chunk is affected only once.

{@creature Velkhana|MHMM} är en traditionell drake med den smala, upprättstående kroppsstrukturen hos äldre drakar som {@creature kushala daora|MHMM}. Dess fjäll och skal har en unik kristallblå färg. Dess huvud har en tiaraliknande krona med små horn. Den åkallar is för att täcka sina vingar, lemmar och svans. Dess tunna, lansliknande svans är mycket flexibel och kan slå mot fiender.

Velkhana kan fritt kontrollera is och kall vind och kan täcka stora områden med is på ett ögonblick. Den andas strålar av superkyld vätska som omedelbart kan frysa monster. När den är täckt av sin isrustning bildas iskristaller i närheten, och när den träffas av Velkhanas isandning bildar de stora spiror som snart exploderar. Ibland bildas små isplattformar som man kan hoppa från. Ibland regnar spikar av is från moln nära marken när den är rasande.

items.name: T.Crystal Shard
entries: {@i Flinch Free.} När du bär den här rustningen kan du inte slås {@condition prone} eller ovilligt flyttas från din nuvarande plats på något sätt.

items.name: T.Velkhana Cortex
entries: {@i Divine Blessing+3.} When you take damage you are not immune or resistant to, roll a d10 and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: T.Velkhana Lash
entries: När du bär den här rustningen är du motståndskraftig mot köldskador och immun mot sjukdomen {@condition iceblight|MHMM}.

items.name: T.Velkhana Hardclaw
entries: När en varelse som rör vid eller träffar dig med ett närstridsvapen inom en radie av 1,5 meter från dig kan du använda din reaktion för att få den att göra ett {@dc 16} räddningskast för konstitutionen. Vid ett misslyckat räddningsförsök drabbas varelsen av {@condition iceblight|MHMM} i 1 minut. En varelse kan upprepa sitt räddningskast i slutet av sin tur, vilket avslutar effekten vid ett lyckat försök. Du kan använda den här egenskapen ett antal gånger som är lika med din 1 + konstitutionsmodifierare (minst 1), och återfår alla förbrukade användningar när du avslutar en lång vila.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crownhorn
entries: {@i (Sorcerer, Warlock, & Wizard only)} This armor has two runes that it regains daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one of these runes to cast {@spell armor of agathys} at 5th level from it.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crystal
entries: Du är immun mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: T.Crystal Shard
entries: {@i Quick Sheath.} När du är inställd på det här vapnet kan du alltid lägga det i skidan som en fri handling även om du redan har dragit ett vapen som en del av din rörelsehandling.

items.name: T.Velkhana Cortex
entries: While attuned to this weapon you can use an action to cast the wall of ice (save {@dc 17}) spell from it, but it deals only {@damage 5d6} cold damage and the wall is only 5 feet high. Once you use this property, new walls deal no damage and are only 3 feet tall until you finish along rest.

items.name: T.Velkhana Lash
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale ice in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Du kan använda den här egenskapen två gånger och återfår alla förbrukade användningar när du avslutar en lång vila.

items.name: T.Velkhana Hardclaw
entries: Your cold spells bypass a creature's resistance to cold damage while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crownhorn
entries: {@i Critical Draw++.} Under den första stridsrundan får dina närstridsvapenattacker en kritisk träff med ett kast på 13 eller högre.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crystal
entries: {@i Coalescence+.} Whenever you succeed on a saving throw to end a condition, you gain a +2 bonus to your attack rolls and spell save DC, and your weapon or spell attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Material för uppgradering av vapen av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Material för uppgradering av rustning av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

entries.name: T.Velkhana Divinity
entries: {@b Set bonus (2):} When you critically hit with a weapon or spell that deals cold damage, you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage.
{@b Set bonus (4):} An aura of frost builds when your weapon is sheathed for at least 1 minute. When you draw this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage for the next 4 rounds.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the teostra's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the teostra or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Explosive Cloud
entries: At the start of the teostra's turn, it beats its wings and four clouds of explosive powder appear in unoccupied 5-foot cubes of air within 60 feet of the teostra. Additionally every 15 feet the Teostra moves, it leaves a cloud of explosive powder in a 5-foot cube. The clouds disperse after detonation, until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it, or when the teostra dies.
As a Bonus action, the teostra can move up to two of these clouds 10 feet in any direction.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The teostra's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The teostra makes three attacks; two claw attacks one bite or tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} för att träffa, räckvidd 3 meter, ett mål. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the teostra jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 33 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the teostra's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the teostra's space.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The teostra exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Supernova
entries: The teostra beats its wings rising 20 feet into the air and releases a large burst of fire all around it. Each creature within 25 foot radius of the teostra must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage and are pushed back 10 feet on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and not pushed back.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The teostra moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The teostra makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Detonate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: All Explosive Clouds detonate and burst into flames. Each creature within 10-feet of a explosive cloud must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If a creature is within range of more than one explosive cloud, they take an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage for each additional cloud.

Teostra is a dragon with leonine features and a fiery coloration. It has a grand mane, large fangs, and a pair of horns that curve backward. Its wings are covered in fur. Teostra is the male counterpart to {@creature Lunastra|MHMM}. Being predatory Elder Dragons Teostra are powerful top predators and are easily capable of killing weaker animals such as {@creature Aptonoth|MHMM}, {@creature Conga|MHMM}, {@creature Bulldrome|MHMM}, {@creature Iodrome|MHMM}, {@creature Apceros|MHMM}, and {@creature Cephadrome|MHMM}. Armed with razor sharp claws and flesh ripping teeth these Elder Dragons make short work of prey and smaller predators.

Possessing mastery over flame, there are few creatures that can hope to last against Teostra for long. To defend itself, the Teostra also utilizes a heat shield which damages enemies that get too close. To keep its flame powers going, they consume coal in volcanic environments. It also has detachable wing scales or powder that explode when ignited from a spark made when Teostra bites. It uses these to defend itself from attackers, although they give little protection against enemies with resilience to extreme heat such as {@creature Akantor|MHMM} or {@creature Lavasioth|MHMM}.

Teostra can even use the powder for many close range attacks but more skilled Teostra have learnt to use the powder at long range. When Teostra angered, it will fly into the air and ignite the powder all at once. When the powder is all ignited, Teostra will be covered in a large burst of fire, that is sometimes referred to as the Supernova.

{@creature tempered teostra|MHMM|Some extremely rare individuals} have more control over their flaming powers than most. They have a different appearance also including more yellow wing webbing, a more reddish mane, red claws, orange tail end and golden eyes. New flame techniques include leaving pockets of explosive powder across the area in the air as it fights and setting them all a flame at will.

Teostra are a very aggressive monster. It will show dominance to anything that it encounters. Compared to Lunastra, who give warnings to get out of its territory, Teostra will ruthlessly attack intruders until they are dead. As one of the most aggressive Elder Dragons, Teostra are highly feared. It is not advised to go out into the Desert, Volcano, Swamp, or Tower when pairing with {@creature Lunastra|MHMM}, as the prospect of fighting both Lunastra and Teostra together is often considered suicidal.

items.name: Fire Dragon Scale
entries: {@i Biology.} Du blir duktig på {@item dung bomb|AGMH} när du bär den här rustningen, och du är immun mot blight-effekter som {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} eller {@spell blight}-besvärjelsen.

items.name: Teostra Carapace
entries: While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell protection from energy} (fire) spell from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

items.name: Teostra Webbing
entries: While wearing this armor you have resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Teostra Horn
entries: {@i Wide-Range.} När du använder {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}s, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}; alla andra varelser inom en radie av tre meter från dig får dess effekt.

items.name: Teostra Gem
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell fire shield} (warm shield) spell from it. Once used, you can't use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: Fire Dragon Scale
entries: {@i Quick Load.} Du kan ladda om som en fri handling när du är inställd på det här vapnet.

items.name: Teostra Carapace
entries: {@i (Bow only) Special Ammo Boost+1.} Your coating now coats up to 25 arrows and your dragonpiercer deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage.

items.name: Teostra Claw
entries: Ditt vapen ger 1d6 extra brandskador.

items.name: Teostra Webbing
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit.} När du har fördel på en anfallsrulle med det här vapnet och du träffar målet kan du låta vapnet orsaka maximal skada om den lägsta av de två d20-rullningarna också skulle träffa målet (alla extra skadetärningar måste fortfarande kastas). Du kan använda den här egenskapen ett antal gånger som är lika med din styrka- eller dexteritetsmodifierare (ditt val), och återfår alla förbrukade användningar när du avslutar en lång vila.

items.name: Teostra Tail
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack using this Weapon, you can engulf the target in flames. At the start of each of the engulfed creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage and it can then make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, putting out the flames on a successful save. Alternatively, the engulfed creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to smother the flames ending the effect.

items.name: Teostra Mane
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Dina vapenattackers räckvidd för kritiska träffar ökar med 1.

items.name: Teostra Horn
entries: {@i Reckless Abandon.} When you make your first attack on your turn with this weapon, you can choose to without care or regard for consequences. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but disadvantage on all saving throws and all attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Teostra Gem
entries: {@i Latent Power +1.} När du reduceras till en fjärdedel av dina maximala träffpoäng för första gången i strid eller i början av din tur på den 10:e stridsrundan, beroende på vad som inträffar först, får du effekterna av {@spell haste} besvärjelsen i 1 minut. När den använts måste du avsluta en kort eller lång vila innan du kan använda den här egenskapen igen.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Material för uppgradering av vapen av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Material för uppgradering av rustning av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

entries.name: A Teostra's Lair
entries: Teostra's lair in high mountains or volcanoes, dwelling in caverns underground in the desert, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized teostra's lair, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a teostra as it sleeps. On rare occasions they can be seen living in more temperate areas such as a swamp or ancient forest, changing the area around it to suit its needs.

A teostra's lair is sometimes confused with a red dragon's lair due to both of them mainly preferring areas with intense heat. On many occasions a teostra will attempt to take a red dragon's lair for its own, either by killing the red dragon or causing it to flee while gravely injured, leaving its horde of treasure behind. The teostra will guard this horde, mainly because it now belongs to him, but will typically not add to its treasure, being more concerned with intruders than riches.
A teostra encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 14 (11,500 XP). A tempered teostra's challenge rating remains the same.

monster.name: Tetranadon

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tetranadon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bloated
entries: When the tetranadon swallows a creature or misses its bite attack, its size increases. While bloated, the tetranadon is Huge and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the tetranadon lacks the room to become Huge, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

If the tetranadon regurgitates a creature or terrain after failing its Constitution saving throw, it is pushed back 10 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tetranadon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, without a running start. In addition, the tetranadon does not incur attacks of opportunity while moving with a jump.

trait.name: Sumo Strike
entries: Whenever the tetranadon makes a palm strike attack, it can move 5 feet as part of the attack. If the tetranadon is not bloated, it makes the movement without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tetranadon makes two palm strike attacks. While enlarged, it makes four palm strike attacks. It can replace any one of these attacks with a water bolt attack.

action.name: Palm Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite (When not bloated only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Miss: The tetranadon swallows a chunk of terrain and becomes bloated. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tetranadon, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tetranadon's turns.

The tetranadon's gullet can hold one creature or chunk of terrain at a time. While the tetranadon isn't {@condition incapacitated}, it can regurgitate the creature at any time {no action required) in a space within 5 feet of it, and is no longer bloated. The creature exits {@condition prone}.

If the tetranadon takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it (or 30 damage or more from a single creature outside of it), the tetranadon must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature or chunk of terrain and is no longer bloated. If it is a creature, it falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the tetranadon. If the tetranadon dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Stomp (Bloated only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the ground in a 10-foot-squared area adjacent to the tetranadon in the direction of the target becomes difficult terrain.

action.name: Boulder Toss (Bloated only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Bolt (When not bloated only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the tetranadon jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked prone, and is pushed 5 feet out of the tetranadon's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the tetranadon's space.

legendaryHeader: The tetranadon can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The tetranadon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Stand
entries: If the tetranadon is prone, it stands up.

legendary.name: Stunning Strike
entries: The tetranadon chooses a creature within 5 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the tetranadon's next turn.

legendary.name: Muck Blast
entries: The tetranadon exhales gravel and water in a 15-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage and be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't afflicted with waterblight on a successful one. A creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the waterblight on itself on a success.

The tetranadon is an amphibian with an inflatable belly and a turtle-like shell on their back. It has algae-like fur on its head, front legs, shell, and tail. With a toothless, platypus-like beak and webbed feet. Its eyes are orange and have the horizontal pupil common to amphibians. On its head is a crest that looks very similar to the head dish of the mythological Kappa.
When its belly is not inflated, it walks on all fours; once enough debris is swallowed, however, its belly inflates to an incredible size, and it starts standing on its hindlegs.

The tetranadon are known to swallow large amounts of gravel, which causes their belly to inflate to enormous proportions. In their bloated state, tetranadon become very sluggish, yet their attacks become more powerful, capable of shattering earth with a stomp. The tetranadon's attacks in this state can be described as "sumo-like". Surprisingly, they are capable of jumping high in the air even when their belly is inflated.

The tetranadon are known to clash with {@creature arzuros|MHMM}. When in their bloated state, they have been seen trying to swallow an arzuros during this battle. However the stocky fanged beasts are too difficult for the greedy amphibians to consume.

items.name: Tetranadon Hide
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to cold damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Tetranadon Carapace
entries: Moss grows on the shoulders of your armor where a urinamako (sea cucumber) magically appears to feed on it. No matter what you do, the urinamako always reappears on your shoulder as soon as you lose sight of it. It provides no benefit, other than looking kinda cute.

items.name: Tetranadon Beak
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} När du är inställd på den här rustningen kan du använda alla förbrukningsvaror, såsom dryck eller mat, som en bonusåtgärd, så länge det är du som förbrukar dem.

items.name: Aqua Sac
entries: You can hold breath underwater for twice as long as normal while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tetranadon Disc
entries: {@i Evade Extender (S).} You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tetranadon Hide
entries: {@i (Monk only)} While you are attuned to this armor, you may spend one minute contemplating the patterns etched on this weapon's surface and regain a number of expended ki points equal to half your proficiency modifier. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Tetranadon Carapace
entries: {@i (Bowgun only)} Your normal ammo deals an extra 2 piercing damage.

items.name: Tetranadon Beak
entries: When you make an unarmed strike while attuned to this weapon, and roll a 20 for the attack roll, the target is pushed 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Aqua Sac
entries: You can cast the {@spell water breathing} spell once per long rest, while attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Tetranadon Disc
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Aim Booster.} Before you make an attack with this weapon, you can use your bonus action to grant yourself advantage on the attack roll. You can use this property a number of times equal to 1/2 your proficiency modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Shiny Nacre
entries: {@i Orb formed within the body of a Tetranadon; possibly made of soul.} When you break the orb a soul escapes allowing you to ask one question as if by the {@spell speak with dead} spell.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Sällsynt material för uppgradering av rustning.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tetsucabra can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tetsucabra's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, without a running start. In addition, the tetsucabra does not incur attacks of opportunity while moving with a jump.

trait.name: Dig
entries: As a bonus action, the tetsucabra digs up a boulder (10 AC, 5hp) with its tusks granting it +3 AC. It can then use its Boulder Toss as an Action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tetsucabra makes two attack, one with its Gore and one with its Stomp.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) blåslagningsskada.

action.name: Boulder Toss (requires Boulder)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Tetsucabra is a large Amphibian with a striking orange and indigo coloration. Its lower jaw harbors large tusks along with a large set of molars that are capable of crushing prey with ease. Tetsucabra also has a spiky stubby tail that swells up when angered.

The scales of a Tetsucabra is used mainly for camouflage inside caves and on them is a special oil that holds heat. Despite the look of the scales, its skin is actually flexible yet hard somewhat resembling an actual toad's skin. A Tetsucabra's skull is robust and durable enough to take a lot of damage from threats of all sorts. Though the Tetsucabra has two large tusks, these are not used for hunting. The primary function of these tusks is for defense and as means to manipulate the environment. The tusks themselves are capable weapons, but the Tetsucabra is also capable of hefting up heavy boulders. The Tetsucabra flings these boulders out of the way of its path but it can also use this as a method of attack to injure predator and prey alike. It uses these boulders as a shield against predators and hunters to prevent attacks. It also uses this to enclose small, tight areas, making it harder to maneuver. Another fact about the Tetsucabra is its ability to spit a glob of fluid at prey items. This sticky material acts as a powerful adhesive, sticking to the body and ground like glue. Even for a hunter, the adhesive quality of this material is not very strong, but it makes every movement a labor and greatly weakens the prey, leading to a reduction in stamina. When the Tetsucabra exerts itself, its tail inflates, possibly to help it balance itself as it picks up large boulders and rocks. The legs of a Tetsucabra help it perform powerful leaps, lunges, and jumps in the air to help it either ambush prey or to reach steep slopes out of its reach. A Tetsucabra's claws are powerful enough to break rock with ease and can destroy powerful armor.

Tetsucabra are highly aggressive, territorial monsters though their ecology is much like a frog. The amphibians are well-known for attacking and eating anything that moves in their line of sight and leaping from ponds in order to grab potential prey. Despite being found in ponds, they spend most of their time on land, which could suggest that they patrol their territory on land, much like {@creature Zamtrios|MHMM}. During the breeding season male Tetsucabra will create large holes to impress females so that they'll lay their eggs in them. When the female lays her eggs in the pit the male will quickly fertilize them. After fertilizing the eggs the male will then carry them in his mouth and he will not eat anything until the offspring are fully developed.

items.name: Tetsucabra Scale
entries: När du bär den här rustningen kan du använda din reaktions- eller bonusåtgärd för att få motstånd mot brandskador fram till slutet av din nästa tur. När du väl använder den här egenskapen kan du inte använda den igen förrän du avslutar en lång vila.

items.name: Tetsucabra Shell
entries: När du måste lyckas med ett räddningskast eller bli knockad {@condition prone} får du en bonus på +2.

items.name: Dignified Skull
entries: {@i Well Rested.} When you finish a long rest, you gain 5 temporary hit points for 24 hours while attuned to this armor.

items.name: Tetsucabra Tusks
entries: You gain a burrowing speed of 10 feet while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tetsucabra Scale
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to conjure an ethereal pickaxe at will. When using this pickaxe to mine, you have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.

items.name: Tetsucabra Claw
entries: While attuned this weapon, you can cast the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip at will.

items.name: Dignified Skull
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Deadeye.} Ditt vapens normala attackräckvidd ökar med 6 meter.

items.name: Tetsucabra Tusks
entries: {@i (Hammer only) Punish Draw.} A creature hit for the first time by the Hammer's {@i Mighty Weapon}, has disadvantage on the saving throw.

items.name: Paddock Oil
entries: When this oil is applied to the skin, the target gains {@sense tremorsense} out to 30 feet for 1 hour.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Ovanligt material för uppgradering av rustning.

monster.name: Thunder Serpent Narwa

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the narwa fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The narwa has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magnetism (1/round)
entries: The first time the narwa uses an action, legendary action, or effect that deals lightning damage on a turn, she causes four chunks of terrain within 60 feet of it to rise into the air until the start of its next turn. The raised terrain fills a 10-foot squared by 5-foot deep area. If there are large objects made of metal, like ballistas or pockets of ore, those areas targeted first by this trait.

trait.name: Resonance
entries: The first time an elf, wyverian, creature who can deal psychic damage, or has psionic abilities enters a location 1 mile of the narwa, they must succeed on a {@dc 25} Intelligence or Wisdom saving throw (target's choice). A creature with psionic abilities makes their save with advantage.

On a successful save, the target resonates with the narwa. When the resonating creature is within 1 mile of the narwa, its eyes glow a yellow color, it can hear the narwa's thoughts. The creature can also sense the narwa's presence and may speak the narwa's thoughts out loud when they are within 600 feet of it. On a failed save, the creature does not resonate with the narwa and is immune to the narwa's Resonance forever.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The narwa deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The narwa uses her Lightning Coil. She then makes two attacks with her bite or one with her tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from the narwa.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Homing Bolts
entries: {@atk rw} automatic hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d4 + 6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Coil
entries: The narwa uses one of the following coils:

items.name: Coil Burst
entries: The narwa unleashes a number of lightning coils in a 60-foot cone in front of her. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Imploding Coil
entries: The narwa releases an already expanded lightning coil that slowly shrinks until it explodes at a point within 120-feet of him. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Triple Coil Slam
entries: The narwa summons three lightning coils that come crashing down in a 15-foot radius around her. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Divine Ire (1/day)
entries: The narwa rises up to 90 feet into the air without provoking opportunity attacks before exhaling lightning in a 30-foot-radius, 90-foot-high cylinder centered directly below her. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Terrain created by its magnetism due to this action remains until the end of its next turn.

On her subsequent turn, if the narwa flies towards the ground as part of its movement, she can use its action to release a lightning bomb that explodes in a 60-foot radius centered on the ground directly below the narwa. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: The narwa can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ibushi regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Divine Light Show (1/round)
entries: The narwa unleashes eight 5-foot wide, 40-foot tall lightning spires each appearing in a space adjacent to the narwa. The spires travel 60 feet in a straight line directly away from narwa. Additionally two 5-foot tall lightning coils (one 5 feet above the ground and another 15 feet above the ground) expand outward from the narwa in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in the spires line, or coils area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature on raised terrain from the narwa's magnetism automatically succeeds on their saving throw.

legendary.name: Dragon's Corkscrew (1/round)
entries: The narwa moves up to her fly speed in a straight line while spinning. During this move she can move through the spaces of other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Each creature the narwa moves through must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and is pushed 5-feet into an unoccupied space out of the way of the narwa's path (PC choice). If there are no unoccupied spaces available, the creature automatically fails their saving throw.

legendary.name: Thundersac Beam (1/round)
entries: The narwa releases beams of lightning from her belly in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage and be afflicted by {@condition thunderblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't afflicted with thunderblight on a successful one.

legendary.name: Lightning Cannon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The narwa exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 49 ({@damage 14d6}) lightning damage and be afflicted by {@condition thunderblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't afflicted with thunderblight on a successful one.

legendary.name: Spark Blast (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The narwa electrifies the air in a 40-foot long, 20-foot wide area that combusts in a cascade of lightning blasts. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and isn't stunned.

Narwa are the female of an elder dragon species that consists of itself and the {@creature Wind Serpent Ibushi|MHMM}. Similar to {@creature Amatsumagatsuchi|MHMM|Amatsu}, this species has a long and leviathan-like body with short and stubby hind legs and a long tail (though in the Serpent's case the legs are more paddle or fin-like). This species also exhibits double jaws, with the lower outer jaw and both inner jaws being able to split.

Being the female of the species, Narwa have several traits that set itself apart from Ibushi, notably the numerous golden and orange tendrils that extends from the back of the head all the way to the tail. It has two large, backward-facing horns on the head. The mouth has multiple smaller teeth. Between the hind legs is a gigantic golden sac, in which Ibushi lacks, and on Narwa's head, chest, back, forelegs, and tail tips are purple electrical organs that produce electromagnetic force that lifts the serpent airborne.

Not much is known about Narwa prior to its discovery. With the help of Minoto's resonation with the Thunder Serpent, the guild was able to determine Narwa's whereabouts while she was waiting for her "king". Every fifty years, Narwa, as well as the Wind Serpent Ibushi, will emerge to mate with each other, while Ibushi wanders around various locales, Narwa seems to wait in a location she prefers until Ibushi is able to locate her. However, the disturbance caused by her presence and electromagnetic abilities tend to drive other monsters berserk, leading to a Rampage event that regularly hits Kamura Village during the Serpent's mating process.

items.name: Narwa Carapace
entries: {@i Constitution.} Varaktigheten av fördröjande effekter, såsom {@spell slow} trollformeln eller en koppardragons andningsattack, reduceras med hälften när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Narwa Hide
entries: {@i Evade Window.} Den här rustningen har 3 runor, och den återfår 1d3 förbrukade runor dagligen i gryningen. När du misslyckas med ett räddningskast för Dexterity när du bär den kan du använda din reaktion för att använda 1 av dess runor för att lyckas med räddningskastet istället.

items.name: Narwa Horn
entries: While attuned to this armor you can cast the {@spell levitate} spell at will, but you can only target metallic objects that aren't being worn or carried.

items.name: Narwa Sparksac
entries: You have a flying speed of 60 feet while you wear this armor.

items.name: Narwa Tentacle
entries: {@i (Lance & Greatsword only)} Your Guard AC bonus now lasts until the start of your next turn and you cannot be knocked {@spell prone}.

items.name: Narwa Claw
entries: {@i Marathon Runner+.} När du bär den här rustningen ökar din gånghastighet med 10 fot och du ignorerar svår terräng om den inte har skapats av en magisk effekt.

items.name: Thunder Serpent Orb
entries: {@i Resonance.} When you attune to this armor for the first time, choose one willing creature which you are familiar with. While attuned to this armor, you and the willing creature are linked as if by the {@spell telepathy} spell. You cannot link to a new creature until the willing creature dies. The link is also lost if the material is removed from the armor or trinket.

items.name: Narwa Carapace
entries: {@i Artillery+2.} While attuned to this weapon, your wyvernfire can now be used three times per long rest and you can add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage of your shell attacks.

items.name: Narwa Hide
entries: {@i (Greatsword & Lance Only) Offensive Guard.} När du använder en reaktion som ökar din AC, ger nästa attack du gör med det vapnet extra skada som är lika stor som den bonus AC som reaktionen gav.

items.name: Narwa Horn
entries: {@i Rapid Morph.} While attuned to this weapon, you can switch its modes as a free action.

items.name: Narwa Sparksac
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, your lightning spells bypass a creature's resistance.

items.name: Narwa Tentacle
entries: {@i Partbreaker+2.} Du orsakar 1d8 extra skada när du träffar kritiskt med det här vapnet.

items.name: Narwa Claw
entries: {@i (Magnet spike only)} While you are attuned to this weapon your magnet spike properties gain the following benefits:

items: You can affix one additional magnetic sphere to another creature. Each sphere can be recalled separately as a bonus action.
The maximum range of your magnetic field assault increases by 10 feet.
Its magnetic force evade pulls you an additional 5 feet away from the attacker.
The save DC of its magnetic bind is increased by 2.

items.name: Thunder Serpent Orb
entries: {@i Critical Draw++.} Under den första stridsrundan får dina närstridsvapenattacker en kritisk träff med ett kast på 13 eller högre.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Material för uppgradering av vapen av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Material för uppgradering av rustning av vilken sällsynthet som helst.

entries.name: Narwa Material Bonus*
entries: When a character has 2+ narwa materials socketed into their equipment they gain each of the following the {@i Thunder Alignment} bonuses.
{@b Thunder Alignment (2 materials).} You have resistance to lightning damage while you wear this armor.
{@b Thunder Alignment (3 materials).} You have immunity to lightning damage while you wear this armor.

{@b Thunder Alignment (4 materials).} This armor has three lucky points. It regains all expended points daily at dawn. When you roll on a creature's loot table you can expend one lucky point, to reroll it and take the new roll.
{@i *The Thunder Alignment bonuses ignore the standard armor rules.}

trait.name: Enrage (1/Day)
entries: The first time the tigrex hp drop below half of its maximum, it enrages for 1 minute. While enraged, the tigrex damage is increased by +5 and its movement is increased by 10 ft.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the tigrex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tigrex makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 12} to hit, piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 (({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) blåslagningsskada.

action.name: Violent Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The tigrex roars loudly in a 15 foot radius around them. All creatures in the area become {@condition deafened} and must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 9d10}) thunder damage on a failed saving throw or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The tigrex makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Tigrex gör en svansattack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tigrex moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the tigrex moves through must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and are knocked {@condition prone}.

Tigrex is a large, quadrupedal wyvern characterized by its massive head and jaws, powerful limbs and striking yellow/blue striped coloration. The top of its head is tipped with a pair of horn-like ears, and its segmented tail ends with a spiny protrusion.

As a quadrupedal wyvern, its wings have evolved into forelegs, which allows it to run at very fast speeds. Though it possesses a pair of adequately-developed wings, it is rarely seen flying in a traditional sense. It is in fact more prone to gliding from location to location. It has a powerful set of lungs which gives it the ability to produce extremely loud, concussive roars which can physically damage nearby objects. The Tigrex relies on its sheer brute strength to bring down opponents.

When idle, Tigrex will assume a bipedal gait, standing only upon its hind legs while holding its forelimbs at its side. When threatened or engaging prey, however, it will stand upon all fours and ready itself for combat. It will usually attempt to intimidate would-be attackers with an ear-splitting roar. The Tigrex can be found in many different environments. If combat becomes intense enough, it will flush blood to its forelimbs, face, and eyes, in order to give its skin a bright-red glow as an effort to further intimidate attackers. Like many wyverns, it will travel far and wide in search of prey.

items.name: Tigrex Scale
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Survival} checks when tracking a creature while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tigrex Claw
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} När du är inställd på den här rustningen kan du använda alla förbrukningsvaror, såsom dryck eller mat, som en bonusåtgärd, så länge det är du som förbrukar dem.

items.name: Tigrex Carapace
entries: {@i Marathon Runner+.} När du bär den här rustningen ökar din gånghastighet med 10 fot och du ignorerar svår terräng om den inte har skapats av en magisk effekt.

items.name: Tigrex Tail
entries: Du är motståndskraftig mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Tigrex Fang
entries: {@i Tranquilizing Guru.} While you wear this armor, you are able to detect when a monster is weakened enough to be captured.

items.name: Tigrex Scalp
entries: Du är immun mot brandskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Tigrex Scale
entries: Ditt vapen ger 1d8 extra snittskador.

items.name: Tigrex Claw
entries: You have advantage on death saving throws while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Tigrex Carapace
entries: {@i Earplugs.} När du är inställd på det här vapnet kan du använda en bonusåtgärd för att trolla fram två öronproppar i valfri form. När du använder dessa öronproppar räknas du som {@condition deafened} och du har fördel på räddningskast mot åskskskador. Du kan avlägsna öronpropparna som en bonushandling som avslutar den dövhetsskapande effekten.

items.name: Tigrex Tail
entries: {@i Strong Attack.} När du träffar en varelse med det här vapnet kan du använda din bonusåtgärd för att skjuta varelsen 10 fot bakåt.

items.name: Tigrex Fang
entries: {@i Mind's Eye.} Dina attacker med det här vapnet förbigår alla varelsers motståndskraft mot skada.

items.name: Tigrex Scalp
entries: Ditt vapen ger 1d10 extra snittskador.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Alla tigrexmaterial är förbannade. Om du blir anpassad till den rustning eller det vapen som materialet är infört i utökar du förbannelsen till dig. Så länge du är förbannad är du under följande effekter:

items: Du är ovillig att lämna ifrån dig vapnet eller rustningen och har den alltid inom räckhåll.
Du har nackdel på attackkast med andra vapen än det här, om det inte finns någon fiende inom 60 fot från dig som du kan se eller höra.

När en fientlig varelse skadar dig måste du lyckas med ett {@dc 15} visdomssparkast eller bli berserk. DC ökar med 1 för varje ytterligare tigrexmaterial som sätts in i din rustning eller ditt vapen. Medan du är berserk måste du använda din handling varje runda för att attackera den varelse som är närmast dig med ditt vapen. Om du kan göra extra attacker som en del av Attack-åtgärden använder du dessa extra attacker och flyttar dig för att attackera nästa närmsta varelse efter att du fällt ditt nuvarande mål. Om du har flera möjliga mål attackerar du ett slumpmässigt. Du är berserk tills du börjar din tur med inga varelser inom 60 fot från dig som du kan se eller höra.

trait.name: Wounded Fury
entries: While it has 62 hit points or fewer, the tobi-kadachi has advantage on attack rolls. In addition, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage to any target it hits with a melee attack.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tobi-kadachi's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: The tobi-kadachi has a gliding speed of 60 feet. When the tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tobi-kadachi makes three attacks. two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

Tobi-Kadachi's face resembles a colubrid in appearance with grayish blue scales covering its slim squirrel-like shape. On its back are patches of white fur as well as a bushy tail covered in rows of spikes. Its front limbs also have a few spikes.

As Tobi-Kadachi fights, it picks up static electricity in its fur by brushing against trees and the ground. Tobi-Kadachi uses this static electricity to increase the strength of its attacks. Like a flying squirrel, Tobi-Kadachi has a membrane between its limbs that allow it to glide for long distances.

Tobi-Kadachis are arboreal predators that use their mobility and static electricity to pursue and pounce on prey such as {@creature mosswine|MHMM}s, {@creature vespoid|MHMM}s, both forest and woodland pteryxs, and rarely, {@creature jagras|MHMM}.

Tobi-Kadachis compete with other large monsters, such as {@creature Rathalos|MHMM} and {@creature Anjanath|MHMM}, for both prey and territory, with the Fanged Wyverns often being overpowered by the aforementioned species.

Tobi-Kadachi are normally quite reclusive, preferring to skulk in the darker, more tangled regions of the Ancient Forest. If angered however, they can become quite dangerous, and caution is advised when dealing with them.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Pelt
entries: You can don or doff your armor as an action, while you are attuned to this armor.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Scale
entries: Du har en +3-bonus på {@skill Acrobatics} kontroller när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Membrane
entries: When you place this material into your armor it gains a gliding membrane, which extends from your forearms to your hindlegs. As an action or reaction, you can extend your arms to reduce your fall speed to 10 feet per round while traveling in a forward motion until you reach the ground, you are {@condition grappled}, or you use your action to end the effect early. If you are falling straight down, you may choose the direction you travel when you begin your glide. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Claw
entries: {@i Jump Master+.} While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: Tobi Electro Sac
entries: While wearing this armor, your walking speed becomes 30 feet, unless your walking speed is higher, and your speed isn't reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor. In addition, you can jump three times the normal distance, though you can't jump farther than your remaining movement would allow.

items.name: Kadachi Gem
entries: {@i Evade Extender (S).} You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Pelt
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to have this weapon to return to your hand so long as it is within 200 feet of you.

items.name: Tobi-Kadachi Claw
entries: Your lightning spells deal an extra 1d4 lightning damage.

items.name: Tobi Electro Sac
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d4 lightning damage.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Sällsynt material för uppgradering av rustning.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tobi-kadachi's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Gliding
entries: When the tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tobi-kadachi makes three attacks: two with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Tobi-Kadachi's face resembles a colubrid in appearance with grayish blue scales covering its slim squirrel-like shape. On its back are patches of white fur as well as a bushy tail covered in rows of spikes. Its front limbs also have a few spikes.

As Tobi-Kadachi fights, it picks up static electricity in its fur by brushing against trees and the ground. Tobi-Kadachi uses this static electricity to increase the strength of its attacks. Like a flying squirrel, Tobi-Kadachi has a membrane between its limbs that allow it to glide for long distances.

Tobi-Kadachis are arboreal predators that use their mobility and static electricity to pursue and pounce on prey such as {@creature mosswine|MHMM}s, {@creature vespoid|MHMM}s, both forest and woodland pteryxs, and rarely, {@creature jagras|MHMM}.

Tobi-Kadachis compete with other large monsters, such as {@creature Rathalos|MHMM} and {@creature Anjanath|MHMM}, for both prey and territory, with the Fanged Wyverns often being overpowered by the aforementioned species.

Tobi-Kadachi are normally quite reclusive, preferring to skulk in the darker, more tangled regions of the Ancient Forest. If angered however, they can become quite dangerous, and caution is advised when dealing with them.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Pelt
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Scale
entries: During a short or long rest you can spend your time crafting a bug zapper. When you fail a check to capture an {@table insects|AGMH|insect}, you can use the bug zapper to succeed instead.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Membrane
entries: When you place this material into your armor it gains a gliding membrane, which extends from your forearms to your hindlegs. As an action or reaction, you can extend your arms to slow your descent to 30 feet until the end of the round. If you land before the round ends, you take no falling damage and land on your feet. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Claw
entries: {@i Jump Master.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to double your jump distance. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses on a short or long rest.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Pelt
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to have this weapon to return to your hand so long as it is within 60 feet of you.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Scale
entries: När du kastar en trollformel som ger blixtskador lägger du till 1/2 av din kompetensbonus till den skadan.

items.name: Tobi-Kit Membrane
entries: When you touch this weapon to a liquid, you know if it is poisonous or if there is poison in it. If it is poison you also identify the name of the poison (if it has one) and its effects. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Sm Monster Bone
entries: Ovanligt material för uppgradering av rustning.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the tzitzi-ya-ku moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a talon Attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the tzitzi-ya-ku can make one tail Attack against it as a Bonus Action.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku makes two attacks: one bite attack and one with its talon.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku emits a bright flash of light from the fins on its head in a 60 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Talon
entries: The tzitzi-ya-ku makes one Talon attack.

Tzitzi-Ya-Ku is a theropod of a navy blue coloration. It has long, powerful back legs, and muscular forelegs complete with three claws for grasping prey. Perhaps its most unique feature is the pair of retractable frills that line either side of its head, which are bright and vividly colorful in appearance. Its back is lined with a row of short spines, and it has wide, sturdy feet.

Tzitzi-Ya-Ku is able to emit bright flashes of light from the fins on the sides of its head. This can be used to disorient attackers and prey alike, allowing the monster to gain the upper hand in combat. Its powerful hind legs can be used to deliver potent kicks during battle.

This monster is comparatively low on the food chain, so it uses the dark colouration of its body to blend in and stalk its prey amongst the shadowy undergrowth of the Coral Highlands, far below the jurisdiction of the powerful Wyverns that rule the local ecosystem.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Scale
entries: This armor is 10% lighter than normal armor of this type. If it has a Strength requirement to use, it is reduced by 1.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Hide
entries: Du har en +2 bonus på {@skill Sleight of Hand} kontroller när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Claw
entries: You cannot become intoxicated while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Photophore
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition stunned} condition, {@condition unconscious} condition, or other sleep-like effects; you do so with a +2 bonus.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Gem
entries: While wearing this armor, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Scale
entries: Your eyes glow red while you are touching your weapon.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Hide
entries: While you hold this weapon, you can use an action to speak this weapon's command word to ignite the magic in it, causing it to flare brilliantly. Each creature within a 10-foot radius of you that can see you, must use their reaction to shield their eyes or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Claw
entries: När du kastar en trollformel som ger blixtskador lägger du till 1/2 av din kompetensbonus till den skadan.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Photophore
entries: This weapon has 3 runes. When you hit a creature, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku Gem
entries: {@i (Druid, Sorcerer, & Wizard only)} While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell color spray} from it spell once per day, without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Sällsynt material för uppgradering av rustning.

items.name: Dash Extract
entries: Hantverksmaterial för {@item mega dash juice|AGMH}.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The ukanlos can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ukanlos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ukanlos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ukanlos makes three attacks; one with its bite, one with its claw and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}) . Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ukanlos can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ice Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The ukanlos exhales a stream of ice in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 13d6}) cold damage and is {@condition restrained} by the ice on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one and is not {@condition restrained}.

The {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, escaping from the ice on a success. The effect ends if the ice is destroyed. The ice has AC 12, 30 hit points, resistance to slashing and piercing damage, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerable to fire damage.

action.name: Crush
entries: If the ukanlos uses all of its movement to rise up on its hindlegs, it can then use its action to slams its body in an area within 10 feet of its location that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage + 21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) cold damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the ukanlos's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the ukanlos's space.

action.name: Launch
entries: The Ukanlos digs its shovel-like jaw into the ground under a creature or object. If it is a creature, they must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be tossed 40 feet up in the air and 15 feet away from the Ukanlos taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) upon landing. If there is a creature in the location the target lands, they must make the same saving throw or take the same amount of damage.

legendary.name: Toss
entries: The ukanlos uses its Launch.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The ukanlos makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

legendary.name: Swim (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The ukanlos digs partially under the ground and exposing its razor sharp back and moves up to its burrow speed, during this move it may move through other creatures. Any creatures the ukanlos moves through must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

A mysterious wyvern said only to appear after large avalanches deep in the snowy mountains. Often seen crushing ice balls and rock into powder in its stride, it's known to most as Ukanlos, although there are whisperings it may be the white god... Ukanlos is a Flying Wyvern that is closely related to the {@creature Akantor|MHMM}. Originally, like Akantor, Ukanlos was classified as a Elder Dragon due to it not fitting in any other class but after much research it has been found to be a large species of Flying Wyvern.

Ukanlos are apex predators that can virtually feed on anything they'd want. Animals like {@creature Popo|MHMM}, {@creature Bulldrome|MHMM}, and {@creature Anteka|MHMM} are common prey. However being indiscriminate feeders Ukanlos will also prey on other predators such as {@creature Tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature Barioth|MHMM}, {@creature Khezu|MHMM}, {@creature Blangonga|MHMM}, Abiorugu, Doragyurosu, {@creature Deviljho|MHMM} and even Elder Dragons such as {@creature Kirin|MHMM} or {@creature Kushala Daora|MHMM} are fair game for these behemoths. Ukanlos will also eat the ice and absorb minerals, however this beast is rather large so the amount of ice it would have to eat would be huge.

Ukanlos closely resembles Akantor in body structure and possesses the same quadrupedal gait. It has a silvery-white carapace which features a row of large, jagged fins along its back. It has a small, compact face which features glowing yellow eyes, sharp teeth, and a massive, shovel-like jaw. Its massive serrated shovel-like jaw allows it to fling up large chunks of ice and to dig through the ice with ease. Ukanlos has grown an extremely tough and streamlined carapace with large razor sharp fins running along its spine to "swim" though the ice.

The Ukanlos can produce an ice beam from its mouth to attack anything foolish enough to attempt to harm it, and is known to use its heavy body weight to crush opponents and its jaws are capable of crushing ice and rock alike. Despite its great size and weight, Ukanlos is known to be able to leap significant distances. In order to survive the weather this creature may have a large layer of fat underneath its hard shell. This layer of flesh is visible underneath its forearms, showing a light-blue underflesh. This beast also hibernate for vast periods of time to survive after feeding.

Ukanlos lives a solitary life, and has only ever been encountered in remote, frozen regions. It is fiercely territorial to any who intrude upon its land. Ukanlos have been found to attack and destroy villages that are built in its territory after waking from hibernation.

items.name: Ukanlos Carapace
entries: You can conjure a {@item Decanter of Endless Water|DMG} (DMG 161) at will while you are attuned to this armor, but if it leaves your hands, it vanishes into thin air.

items.name: Ukanlos Underscale
entries: {@i Tremor-Proof.} Du kan inte bli knockad {@condition prone} när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Ukanlos Digger
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell move earth} spell. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Ukanlos Fin
entries: You have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight while you wear this armor.

items.name: Ukanlos Tail
entries: You can stand on and move across any liquid surface as if it were solid ground while you wear this armor.

items.name: Ukanlos Shoveljaw
entries: You have an emblem of water pouring out of a bowl on your armor. You can use an action to speak the armor's command word and summon a {@creature water elemental}, as if you had cast the {@spell conjure elemental} spell. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Ukanlos Gem
entries: Du är immun mot köldskador när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Ukanlos Carapace
entries: {@i Quick Load.} Du kan ladda om som en fri handling när du är inställd på det här vapnet.

items.name: Ukanlos Underscale
entries: Your cold spells ignore a creature's resistance to cold damage while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Ukanlos Digger
entries: {@i (Bow only)} Whenever you apply a coating to your arrows, you can coat up to 5 more.

items.name: Ukanlos Fin
entries: När du håller i det här vapnet kan du använda en åtgärd för att låta ett kakofoniskt vrål ljuda. Varje varelse i en radie på 15 fot som betraktar dig som en fiende måste göra ett {@dc 16} visdomssparkast. Vid ett misslyckat räddningsförsök blir varelsen {@condition frightened} av dig i 1 minut. En varelse kan upprepa räddningskastet i slutet av var och en av sina varv, och avslutar effekten på sig själv vid ett lyckat försök. Om en varelses räddningskast lyckas eller om effekten upphör för den är varelsen immun mot denna effekt i 24 timmar.

items.name: Ukanlos Tail
entries: You gain a + 2 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC while attuned to this weapon. This bonus increases to +4 when the spell you are casting deals cold damage, such as {@spell ice knife|XGE} or {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|XGE} spells.

items.name: Ukanlos Shoveljaw
entries: {@i (Sorcerer & Wizard only)} This weapon has 10 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell ice knife|XGE} (1 rune), {@spell ice storm} (4 runes), or {@spell wall of ice} (4 runes). The weapon regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Ukanlos Gem
entries: När du är inställd på det här vapnet ger dina kalla trollformler full skada på en varelse som är motståndskraftig mot kalla skador och halva skadan på en varelse som är immun mot kalla skador.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Uragaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The uragaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the Uragaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Emit Flames
entries: (2/per Long rest). The uragaan releases a wave of fire from its underside in a 10-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and catches fire on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and does not catch fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Uragaan is covered in a lustrous gold-colored hide. Its back is lined with hard crystals and its chin is plated with a rock-like shell, suggesting the Uragaan has evolved a tough exterior due to life in volcanic regions. Its underbelly is covered in a sticky, tar-like substance which it uses to affix explosive rocks to itself.

Uragaan's signature ability is to roll its body into a wheel to increase its speed and agility. The growths on their back stable this rolling ability. It will do this often in an attempt to crush the adventurer. Uragaan create a very effective weapon in the form of its chin by melting minerals and attaching them with lava, which it can use for breaking up rocks. The chin also evens its center of gravity so its legs can compensate for its heavy body. In a group of Uragaan, the one with the largest chin has the highest status among the group.

Uragaan is something of oddity in the food chain - it has almost no natural predators, but is not particularly predatory itself and has no competitors, preferring to consume vast amounts of plants and rock. The rocks that it feeds on are surprisingly nutrient rich, and its rock-hard lower jaw is perfectly designed to break them up, although it does make them awkward to swallow.

items.name: Uragaan Carapace
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to lightning or thunder damage (your choice) until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: U.Firecell Stone
entries: {@i Shield.} While you are attuned to this armor and you use a reaction that would increase your AC, you gain an additional +1 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Uragaan Scute
entries: {@i Guard.} Du kan inte knuffas eller slås bakåt när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: När du är inställd på denna rustning kan du använda en bonusåtgärd för att tala dess kommandorad och andas ut eld mot en måltavla inom 15 fot från dig. Målet måste göra ett {@dc 15} Dexterity räddningskast, och tar {@damage 3d6} brandskada på ett misslyckat räddningskast, eller hälften så mycket skada på ett lyckat.
Once used, this property cannot be used again until you finish a long rest

items.name: Uragaan Marrow
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} Du är immun mot sårande effekter, såsom {@creature Odogaron|MHMM}'s blodiga sår eller {@creature bearded devil}'s infernaliska sår när du bär den här rustningen.

items.name: Uragaan Ruby
entries: {@i Uragaan Protection.} When you must make a saving throw while taking the {@action dodge} action, you can use your Armor Class in place of making the roll. You can use this property three times, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Uragaan Carapace
entries: {@i Sharpening.} During a short or long rest you can spend your time sharpening a bladed weapon. When you hit a creature for the first time after sharpening it, the weapon deals its maximum piercing or slashing damage to the target.

items.name: Uragaan Scale
entries: {@i Carver.} You have advantage on your first carve attempt on a creature while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: U.Firecell Stone
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you can use an action to conjure a {@item alchemist's fire (flask)|PHB|flask of alchemist's fire} once a day. If unused for 24 hours, the flask returns to whence it came, where that is, who knows?

items.name: Uragaan Scute
entries: {@i Partbreaker.} You deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage when you critically hit with this weapon.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, it deals an extra {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

items.name: Uragaan Jaw
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Spread up.} When you hit a creature with {@filter spread ammo|items|source=AGMH|search=spread} and they are within half your normal bowgun range, increase the damage die size by 1.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} för att träffa, räckvidd 1,5 m, ett mål. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) genomträngande skada.

action.name: Fire Spit
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/100 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) fire damage.

Leviathans that inhabit volcanoes. Noted for swarming around larger monsters' kills in order to feed. Uroktor rarely hunt for themselves, but are known for being highly aggressive. Just like their adult form, the {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM}, they have the remarkable ability to tunnel through solid volcanic rock. Uroktor are distinguished by their reddish-purple skin, which protects them from both the sweltering heat and volcanic predators. Uroktor will defend themselves from other monsters and adventurers alike, but will flee if they feel over-whelmed.

items.name: Uroktor Scale
entries: Wisps of harmless, odorless smoke rise from this armor while it is worn.

items.name: Uroktor Scale
entries: As a bonus action, you can speak this weapon's command word, causing it to shed bright light in a 20 foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Ovanligt material för uppgradering av rustning.

items.name: Dragonfell Berry
entries: Can be eaten as a ration.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Om vaal hazak misslyckas med ett räddningskast kan den välja att lyckas istället.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Vaal hazak har fördel på räddningskast mot trollformler och andra magiska effekter.

trait.name: Effluvium Aura
entries: At the start of each of the vaal hazak's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. A creature that touches the vaal hazak or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Vaal hazak återfår 30 träffpunkter i början av sin tur om den har minst 1 träffpunkt. Om vaal hazak tar strålningsskada eller skada från {@item holy water (flask)|PHB|holy water} fungerar inte denna egenskap i början av vaal hazaks nästa tur.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Vaal hazak gör fyra attacker: två med bettet och två med klorna.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Effluvium Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The vaal hazak exhales a cloud of effluvium bacteria in a 90-foot cone.
